name: Clarion Collection Hotel Bastion

reviews.text: Easy to find following a short walk from the central train station,the Hotel Bastion proved to be a great choice for a stay in Oslo.Well located close to Karl Johanns Gate it is in the perfect place for visiting many of the sights of Oslo.
reviews.title: Location,comfort & breakfast

reviews.text: Check in was fast & efficient & within minutes i was in my room.No complaints at all with the room,it was bright,warm,clean,comfortable & roomy with modern furniture & decor.The tv was big screen,a nice change from the usual portable sized tvs that many hotels seem to have.The bathroom was ok in size,not massive but big enough with shower cubicle,hairdryer,plenty of towels but no shaving socket.I asked for a quiet room & that's what i got,away from the street outside & with no noise at all to bother me.
reviews.title: It just gets better and better

reviews.text: The afternoon waffles & coffee were great after my journey & were well appreciated as they stopped the need to leave the hotel to get a snack.I can't comment on the light evening meal that's included in the room price as i had already gone out for the evening before it was served.I most certainly can comment on the breakfast which was superb.It was huge with loads to choose from,easily the biggest & best breakfast that i've had in any hotel & there didn't seem to be any problem for people to get a breakfast well after the official finishing time.
reviews.title: Choose your room wisely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Another nice touch,i checked out around 12 noon & left my baggage in the free left luggage room.The reception staff had no problem with me leaving it there until i collected it at around 18.30 after my day's sightseeing.
reviews.title: Great value, meals and service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For that sightseeing the hotel location was great.Akershus Fortress was,at most,10 minutes walk away with Aker Brygge just a stones throw further on from there & Karl Johanns Gate less than 5 minutes away.The Opera house is also an easy stroll from the hotel.There is a Peppe's Pizza outlet on the same street as the hotel & The Dubliner bar is passed on the way to Akershus.Both within walking distance,Dr Jekyll's & Venterommet bars are well worth a visit.
reviews.title: Strange but lovely:)

reviews.text: Spent 2 nights here recently during a trip around Scandanavia - Staff were friendly and welcoming and Breakfast and complimentary evening buffet was nice.
reviews.title: Great base for exploring the City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is about halfway between the shopping/tourist area and the lively port area. We easily walked to all the major attractions from the Hotel in an hour so this hotel is a good choice. Train station only 10 minutes walk also.
reviews.title: It WAS a great surprise! except for the gym and sauna facilities

reviews.text: If i had to complain about 1 thing it would be the size of the rooms - we got a fairly good deal so maybe we got the smallest one available but we had to removed the desk chair and a couple of other items so that both of our suitcases would fit! We didn't spend much time here so was not a huge problem!
reviews.title: Best hotel I've experienced in Oslo

reviews.text: Overall i would highly reccommend this Hotel.
reviews.title: My one and only favourite hotel in Oslo

reviews.text: Top Tip when visiting Oslo? Food and drink are famously pricey but if you shop around you can get .6L of beer for €6 - €7 but some places charge up to €10. Dont be afraid to ask how much a drink costs as it seems to be the norm! Avoid the Port/Harbour area if you are looking for a cheap drink - the area past the train station seems to be the best value. Also, "Sevenelevens" are found all over Scandanavia and you can pick up a Panini and a coffee for €4 so good choice for lunch!
reviews.title: We will be back

reviews.text: We spent 14 nights in Scandinavia, and this was both the most expensive and worst place we visited. You can do better.
reviews.title: I'll sure come back!

reviews.text: This was our return to Oslo after a "northern lights" venture and we opted to stay here instead of Comfort Hotel Borsparken. On top of the not-so-happy experience, the other reason for our change is - free waffles and light evening meal! And to our absolute delight, the room we were allocated was very spacious (on the corner of 3rd floor) and the lady at the reception on checking-in was absolutely fantastic. (Sorry that I do not remember her name. You will surely notice who she is by her enthusiastic and helpful attitude. A very slim lady.) The hotel is only under 10 minutes on foot from the central station and is quiet, tastefully decorated and cozy.
reviews.title: Could not be better

reviews.text: Same as other Clarion brand, free internet back at the lobby and free all-day tea and coffee. We booked through the hotel website and have absolutely no problems with booking and cancellation.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel
Clarion Collection Hotel Bastion
reviews.text: Wish you all a very nice stay in Norway. We do enjoy ours very much!
10/10 for the friendly, helpful staff.
reviews.title: Comfy
We really liked this hotel
reviews.text: This hotel was described by a reviewer before we booked and it exactly met his description: 3 mins walk to central station and in a rather seedy area - but - it was great. The rooms were compact but comfortable, the staff were excellent, the fitness room, sauna, jaquzi and solarium were accessable by secure elevator. Free soup available each afternoon (necessary when it is cold) and the breakfasts were fantastic (help yourself). the reception area doubled up as a bar for the residents and the whole feeling was one of homeliness - no pretention. There is an open fire which the staff fuel with imitation logs but the effect is similar. Oslo is so small that you can reach the highlights within 3/4 minutes. Great hotel close to the port and probably no further to the train station than most other hotels in Oslo but is situated in a fairly quiet area which at night is often frequented by some dubious persons. We found it cheaper than the 'bigger' hotels but we enjoyed it.

reviews.title: Cosy Colonial Style
reviews.text: I spent two nights in the Hotel Bastion over the past weekend. The hotel is conveniently located for the main downtown area of the city, and is approximately 5-10 mins walk to the main shopping street Karl Johans Gate , and the railway and bus station. The hotel is clean and was refurbished within the past few years. It is decorated in a colonial style, with warm timber furnishings and a log fire by the unusually combined reception/bar.The double room I stayed in was at the front of the hotel, close to the busy main E18 express way. The windows were triple glazed so the room was quiet and pleasantly cosy. The room itself was of sufficient size, although there was only a shower in the en-suite bathroom. The room was clean, however one of the two arm chairs looked liked it needed recovering. The complimentary small bottle of red wine was a pleasant surprise. There was the usual mini bar, trouser press, hairdryer, and TV. Breakfast was included in the price and was served in the candle lit dining room. The food was of good quality.Overall, the hotel was a pleasant place to stay and I would have no problem in recommending it.

I often stay in "design" hotels and was looking forward to experiencing more of the same in Oslo. Upon check-in, I was disappointed to discover that my room looked nothing like the photos. It was as if I had checked into a different hotel. The room was worn looking, and the public areas of the hotel are definitely showing their age. Breakfast was a "get some food before it's gone" and "grab a seat before they're all taken" affair. The only thing I would recommend about the hotel is the location. Although you have to walk through the red light district from the train station to get to the hotel, it's a quick walk to tourist destinations, or to public transport.
reviews.title: Not As Advertised

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Bastion for 2 nights and it was really nice. The room was cosy and warm, and both the bathroom and bedroom were clean and tidy and well equipped. The room had minibar, hairdryer, electrically adjustable beds and in-room safe in the Deluxe Rooms.
reviews.title: Really Nice.
Very cool designer room
reviews.text: The whole hotel feels very homely, which is great to come back to after a hard day's shopping!

reviews.title: Very good hotel, the surounding could be better
reviews.text: The hotel is in a dodgy area, but we walked through the red light district at different times of the day including after 10pm, and we didn't feel unsafe at any time- you'll see dodgy people hanging about, but they don't bother you at all.

reviews.title: not that impressive
reviews.text: Would stay there again, as the atmosphere in the hotel was fab, and the location is excellent - it was just a short stroll into the centre of town - great for eating out, as the hotel doesn't have a restuarant - but a limited room service menu found in the lobby.

We stayed here with an elderly aunt for 4 nights. At short notice it was the cheapest deal we could get in a very expensive city. It is on a relatively dodgy street with interesting nightlife- my friend who lives in Oslo laughed out loud when she heard the address. However it was the most inoffensive red-light district I have come across ( I think that doesn't sound right!)
reviews.title: Very Impressed!

reviews.text: The best thing about this hotel is you get an evening buffet included, it consists of salads, ham, cheese fruit etc with one hot dish. Not the most amazing food, but saves paying for an evening meal elsewhere. The 2nd best thing was free waffles- pretty much unlimited- every afternoon. and free coffee, tea and fruit/ pastries all day in the dining room/ lobby. We really liked the feel of this hotel- intimate, had a nice lounge- we sat by the fire in the evening and the staff were very friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Don't even think on get so close!!

reviews.text: For our elderly aunt it was unfortunate that there was no public transport going past the hotel, and it was a short walk to a bus/tram stop. This wouldn't be an issue for anyone other than elderly folk- it was a 5-10 minute walk to the Radhus area, and Karl Johans Gate.
reviews.title: Nice and cozy!

reviews.text: I would definitely come back here and would recommend to others- mainly because you can have breakfast, waffles/coffee and dinner included in the very reasonable rate that we managed to find which cuts down on your spending dramatically.
reviews.title: Disappointing
Best Kept Secret
reviews.text: We spent three nights at this hotel, and it was, by far, the worst experience we had ever have, after a wonderful 10 day trip to Norway. The hotel was dark and gloomy, the staff was dissapointing, the room was small, dirty and even darker than the lobby. We choose the hotel because we like to experience something different from the standard business hotels, and the "boutique" label attracted us to book it. BUT, once we arrived there we discovered how far from from the nice website picture it was. We intend to change rooms in the very minute we saw it, but the staff told us the hotel was fully book that night, so we would be able to change next morning. So, we packaged again, and left our luggage in the lobby, just to found out that night, that we wouldn't allowed to change, because the morning recepcionist "forgot" to assign a new room for us. Then, again, we had to unpacked our stuff and slept in the same awful room that the night before. Just don't go. It wasn't worth it.... and on top of everything is in the middle of the red light district, so you have to walk through all kind of weird people on your way to anywhere (fortunately Oslo seems to be a quite safe place)

description: Hotellet er inspirert av engelske boutiquehotell og legger vekt på å skape en hjemmekoselig stemning for deg som gjest.Med fyr på peisen ønskes du velkommen til vår spisestue, hvor du også kan Afternoon tea,kveldsmat og frokost - uten tillegg i prisen. Rommene som var nyoppusset sommeren 2009 er gjennomført i en trendy,boutique-stil, mens deluxe-fløyen holdes i en engelsk kolonistil. Noen av rommene har utsikt over det nye Operahuset og havneområdet.
